strDesc: Rare, Old Earth ammunition rounds once known for low recoil, accuracy, and Wild West gunslingers. Firing one in space is likely to end in rapid unplanned decompression.
A powerful Old Earth ammunition known for stopping power and robust recoil, more than ready to breach bodies and bulkheads.
Once-common Old Earth ammunition that can still wreck a pressurized compartment even though smaller in size and firing energy than other Old Earth cartridges.
Standard-gauge anti-personnel ammunition made with hollowgel technology that disperses silica gel beads on impact to minimize risk of hull decompression.
A power pack for high-tech energy weapons.
A classic pick-up weapon from an Old Earth pasttime, usually made of aluminum or fiberglass.
A rare wooden version of the classic pick-up weapon from an Old Earth pasttime, with a faded signature and re-wrapped grip.
A compound crossbow that propels sharpened bolts surprisingly well in micro-gravity. This bowed version is a modern interpretation of medieval designs with a rear reloading winch.
A limbless crossbow that propels sharpened bolts surprisingly well in micro-gravity. This design is more compact than classic bowed versions, but still requires a removable winch to reload.
This age-of-sail deck weapon may seem anachronistic, but in the right hands, the short, curved blade can be effective against unarmored targets in tight spaces.
A remarkable weapon formed from the skull and spine of a massive goat-human hybrid, barbaric to some, effective nonetheless. It allows both piercing and slashing through most protective wear.
A long, curved sword with a 70cm single-edged blade and braided, one- or two-handed grip. Designed for balance, precision, and style, but sometimes long for tight spaces.
A 30.5cm classic combat knife made of carbon steel with leather-ringed handle and partially serrated blade.
Brass knuckles for discreetly adding heft and crack to your punches.
An urban machete with a 46cm tempered steel blade and textured, synthetic grip. Designed for chopping and hacking through obstacles.
A short, side-handle T-baton made of aluminum, fiberglass, or carbon composite. Various batons are often carried by enforcement officers as a defensive compliance tool.
A long, side-handle T-baton made of aluminum, fiberglass, or carbon composite. Tonfa-inspired nightsticks are often carried by enforcement officers as a defensive compliance tool.
An Old Earth classic, single-action projectile handgun with wood-inlaid grip. This semi-automatic, recoil-operated pistol typically holds 8 rounds of .45 ACP ammunition.
A polymer-frame relic of Old Earth, this lightweight semi-automatic handgun typically holds 17 rounds of 9mm ammunition in a detachable magazine.
Even for Old Earth weapons, this K-frame revolver is old-fashioned, holding 6 rounds of .38 Special ammunition in a swing-out cylinder.
A jury-rigged firearm improvised from spare or printed parts, slam guns like these are meant to hold together long enough to fire one or two, hefty Old Earth rounds.
An electronic stun pistol meant to incapacitate theough pain and involuntary muscle contraction. Powered by disposable batteries.
A common, light-weight polymer-body sidearm famously advertised by Smartlink as "hullsafe" due to its use of standard-gauge hollowgel (HG) ammunition.
A small foldable knife that fits in your pocket.

An automatic, projectile combat rifle with lightweight stock, and capacity for 30 rounds of 5.56 mm ammunition. Highly dangerous in pressurized space structures. Often wielded for crowd control and intimidation, but only fired in sanctioned combat.
A Titan-made, high-tech energy rifle requiring a standard, detachable power cell. Very effective against most conventional armor.
An ad hoc blade made of sharpened metal or glass wrapped in cloth, cord, or other similar materials to protect the gripping hand.
A stungun designed to deliver incapacitating shock through physical contact with an electrical arc between two conductive prongs. Powered by disposable batteries.

An Old Earth pump action projectile shotgun firing tiny pellets in a spread, usually with a 6-shell magazine tube. Brutal against bodies at close range. Not advised for use in pressurized space structures.

Shotshell has added perks of doing less damage to sealed hull at any distance, and being less easily traced via forensic ballistics.

A Titan-made, high-tech energy shotgun requiring a standard, detachable power cell, firing armor-penetrating shots in a spread.

Lacking the finesse and energy efficiency of a rifle, this weapon makes it both hard to miss and hard to avoid collateral damage.
A spear with a sharp steel tip on a meter-long haft.
